description: so nice tool for recognize st-link-v2.

ST-Microelectronics microprocessors require a device programmer called the ST-Link (Now in version 3) or a JTAG or UART or Bit-Banger serial connection to program the devices. They also supply a set of Utilities to 'Flash' the drvices from Linux, OSX and that MSDOS child OS.
In Ubuntu this is provided as stlink, and this is a GUI app to run the utilities without the CLI, which seems lazy for somebody programming a microprocessor? But it is nice!
